intro: Delissea scabra, commonly known as the rough delissea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Delissea scabra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
